intro: Melissitus iskanderi, commonly known as the Iskanderi melissite, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
